                            input=nothing, frame_index=nothing, ax=nothing,
                            fig=nothing, colorbar_place=colorbar_place,
                            title=nothing, outfile=nothing, colorscale=identity,
                            transform=identity, axis_args=Dict{Symbol,Any}(),
                            it=nothing, ir=nothing, iz=nothing, ivperp=nothing,
                            ivpa=nothing, ivzeta=nothing, ivr=nothing, ivz=nothing,
                            kwargs...)

Animate var_name from the run(s) represented by run_info (as returned by get_run_info) along vz vs r and vzeta.

If a Vector of run_info is passed, the animations from each run are created in a horizontal row, with each sub-animation having the 'run name' as its subtitle.

it, is, ir, iz, ivperp, ivpa, ivzeta, ivr, and ivz can be used to select different indices (for non-plotted dimensions) or range (for the plotted dimension, except it which is not compatible as a plotted dimension) to use.

colorscale can be used to set the scaling function for the colors. Options are identity, log, log2, log10, sqrt, Makie.logit, Makie.pseudolog10 and Makie.Symlog10. transform is a function that is applied element-by-element to the data before it is plotted. For example when using a log scale on data that may contain some negative values it might be useful to pass transform=abs (to plot the absolute value) or transform=positive_or_nan (to ignore any negative or zero values).

axis_args are passed as keyword arguments to get_2d_ax(), and from there to the Axis constructor.

Extra kwargs are passed to Makie's heatmap!() function.

When a single run_info is passed, an Axis can be passed to ax. If it is, the plot will be created in ax. When ax is passed, a colorbar will be created at colorbar_place if a GridPosition is passed to colorbar_place.

outfile is required for animations unless ax is passed. The animation will be saved to a file named outfile. The suffix determines the file type. If both outfile and ax are passed, then the Figure containing ax must be passed to fig to allow the animation to be saved.

When a single run_info is passed, the (sub-)title can be set with the title argument.

By default the data for the variable is loaded from the output represented by run_info. The data can optionally be passed to data if you have already loaded it.

Returns the Figure, unless ax was passed in which case returns nothing.

By default relevant settings are read from the var_name section of input_dict_dfns (if output that has distribution functions is being read) or input_dict (otherwise). The settings can also be passed as an AbstractDict or NamedTuple via the input argument. Sometimes needed, for example if var_name is not present in input_dict (in which case you would have had to create the array to be plotted and pass it to data).

source
makie_post_processing.iterate_along_vz_vs_r_z — Function
iterate_along_vz_vs_r_z(run_info::Vector{Any}, var_name; is=1, data=nothing,
                        input=nothing, outfile=nothing, colorscale=identity,
                        transform=identity, axis_args=Dict{Symbol,Any}(),
                        it=nothing, ir=nothing, iz=nothing, ivperp=nothing,
                        ivpa=nothing, ivzeta=nothing, ivr=nothing, ivz=nothing,
                        kwargs...)
iterate_along_vz_vs_r_z(run_info, var_name; is=1, data=nothing,
                        input=nothing, frame_index=nothing, ax=nothing,
                        fig=nothing, colorbar_place=colorbar_place,
                        title=nothing, outfile=nothing, colorscale=identity,
                        transform=identity, axis_args=Dict{Symbol,Any}(),
                        it=nothing, ir=nothing, iz=nothing, ivperp=nothing,
                        ivpa=nothing, ivzeta=nothing, ivr=nothing, ivz=nothing,
                        kwargs...)

Animate var_name from the run(s) represented by run_info (as returned by get_run_info) along vz vs r and z.

If a Vector of run_info is passed, the animations from each run are created in a horizontal row, with each sub-animation having the 'run name' as its subtitle.

it, is, ir, iz, ivperp, ivpa, ivzeta, ivr, and ivz can be used to select different indices (for non-plotted dimensions) or range (for the plotted dimension, except it which is not compatible as a plotted dimension) to use.

colorscale can be used to set the scaling function for the colors. Options are identity, log, log2, log10, sqrt, Makie.logit, Makie.pseudolog10 and Makie.Symlog10. transform is a function that is applied element-by-element to the data before it is plotted. For example when using a log scale on data that may contain some negative values it might be useful to pass transform=abs (to plot the absolute value) or transform=positive_or_nan (to ignore any negative or zero values).

axis_args are passed as keyword arguments to get_2d_ax(), and from there to the Axis constructor.

Extra kwargs are passed to Makie's heatmap!() function.

When a single run_info is passed, an Axis can be passed to ax. If it is, the plot will be created in ax. When ax is passed, a colorbar will be created at colorbar_place if a GridPosition is passed to colorbar_place.

outfile is required for animations unless ax is passed. The animation will be saved to a file named outfile. The suffix determines the file type. If both outfile and ax are passed, then the Figure containing ax must be passed to fig to allow the animation to be saved.

When a single run_info is passed, the (sub-)title can be set with the title argument.

By default the data for the variable is loaded from the output represented by run_info. The data can optionally be passed to data if you have already loaded it.

Returns the Figure, unless ax was passed in which case returns nothing.

By default relevant settings are read from the var_name section of input_dict_dfns (if output that has distribution functions is being read) or input_dict (otherwise). The settings can also be passed as an AbstractDict or NamedTuple via the input argument. Sometimes needed, for example if var_name is not present in input_dict (in which case you would have had to create the array to be plotted and pass it to data).

source
makie_post_processing.iterate_along_vz_vs_vpa — Function
iterate_along_vz_vs_vpa(run_info::Vector{Any}, var_name; is=1, data=nothing,
                        input=nothing, outfile=nothing, yscale=nothing,
                        transform=identity, ylims=nothing,
                        axis_args=Dict{Symbol,Any}(), it=nothing, ir=nothing, iz=nothing,
                        ivperp=nothing, ivpa=nothing, ivzeta=nothing, ivr=nothing,
                        ivz=nothing, kwargs...)
iterate_along_vz_vs_vpa(run_info, var_name; is=1, data=nothing,
                        input=nothing, frame_index=nothing, ax=nothing,
                        fig=nothing, outfile=nothing, yscale=nothing,
                        transform=identity, ylims=nothing, label=nothing,
                        axis_args=Dict{Symbol,Any}(), it=nothing, ir=nothing, iz=nothing,
                        ivperp=nothing, ivpa=nothing, ivzeta=nothing, ivr=nothing,
                        ivz=nothing, kwargs...)

Animate var_name from the run(s) represented by run_info (as returned by get_run_info) along vz vs vpa.

If a Vector of run_info is passed, the animations from each run are overlayed on the same axis, and a legend is added.

it, is, ir, iz, ivperp, ivpa, ivzeta, ivr, and ivz can be used to select different indices (for non-plotted dimensions) or range (for the plotted dimension, except it which is not compatible as a plotted dimension) to use.

ylims can be passed a Tuple (ymin, ymax) to set the y-axis limits. By default the minimum and maximum of the data (over all time points) will be used.

yscale can be used to set the scaling function for the y-axis. Options are identity, log, log2, log10, sqrt, Makie.logit, Makie.pseudolog10 and Makie.Symlog10. transform is a function that is applied element-by-element to the data before it is plotted. For example when using a log scale on data that may contain some negative values it might be useful to pass transform=abs (to plot the absolute value) or transform=positive_or_nan (to ignore any negative or zero values).

axis_args are passed as keyword arguments to get_1d_ax(), and from there to the Axis constructor.

Extra kwargs are passed to Makie's lines!() function.

When a single run_info is passed, an Axis can be passed to ax. If it is, the plot will be added to ax.

When a single run_info is passed, label can be passed to set a custom label for the line. By default the run_info.run_name is used.

outfile is required for animations unless ax is passed. The animation will be saved to a file named outfile. The suffix determines the file type. If both outfile and ax are passed, then the Figure containing ax must be passed to fig to allow the animation to be saved.

By default the data for the variable is loaded from the output represented by run_info. The data can optionally be passed to data if you have already loaded it.

Returns the Figure, unless ax was passed in which case returns nothing.

By default relevant settings are read from the var_name section of input_dict_dfns (if output that has distribution functions is being read) or input_dict (otherwise). The settings can also be passed as an AbstractDict or NamedTuple via the input argument. Sometimes needed, for example if var_name is not present in input_dict (in which case you would have had to create the array to be plotted and pass it to data).

source
makie_post_processing.iterate_along_vz_vs_vpa_r — Function
iterate_along_vz_vs_vpa_r(run_info::Vector{Any}, var_name; is=1, data=nothing,
                          input=nothing, outfile=nothing, colorscale=identity,
                          transform=identity, axis_args=Dict{Symbol,Any}(),
                          it=nothing, ir=nothing, iz=nothing, ivperp=nothing,
                          ivpa=nothing, ivzeta=nothing, ivr=nothing, ivz=nothing,
                          kwargs...)
iterate_along_vz_vs_vpa_r(run_info, var_name; is=1, data=nothing,
                          input=nothing, frame_index=nothing, ax=nothing,
                          fig=nothing, colorbar_place=colorbar_place,
                          title=nothing, outfile=nothing, colorscale=identity,
                          transform=identity, axis_args=Dict{Symbol,Any}(),
                          it=nothing, ir=nothing, iz=nothing, ivperp=nothing,
                          ivpa=nothing, ivzeta=nothing, ivr=nothing, ivz=nothing,
                          kwargs...)

Animate var_name from the run(s) represented by run_info (as returned by get_run_info) along vz vs vpa and r.

If a Vector of run_info is passed, the animations from each run are created in a horizontal row, with each sub-animation having the 'run name' as its subtitle.

it, is, ir, iz, ivperp, ivpa, ivzeta, ivr, and ivz can be used to select different indices (for non-plotted dimensions) or range (for the plotted dimension, except it which is not compatible as a plotted dimension) to use.

colorscale can be used to set the scaling function for the colors. Options are identity, log, log2, log10, sqrt, Makie.logit, Makie.pseudolog10 and Makie.Symlog10. transform is a function that is applied element-by-element to the data before it is plotted. For example when using a log scale on data that may contain some negative values it might be useful to pass transform=abs (to plot the absolute value) or transform=positive_or_nan (to ignore any negative or zero values).

axis_args are passed as keyword arguments to get_2d_ax(), and from there to the Axis constructor.

Extra kwargs are passed to Makie's heatmap!() function.

When a single run_info is passed, an Axis can be passed to ax. If it is, the plot will be created in ax. When ax is passed, a colorbar will be created at colorbar_place if a GridPosition is passed to colorbar_place.

outfile is required for animations unless ax is passed. The animation will be saved to a file named outfile. The suffix determines the file type. If both outfile and ax are passed, then the Figure containing ax must be passed to fig to allow the animation to be saved.

When a single run_info is passed, the (sub-)title can be set with the title argument.

By default the data for the variable is loaded from the output represented by run_info. The data can optionally be passed to data if you have already loaded it.

Returns the Figure, unless ax was passed in which case returns nothing.

                          transform=identity, ylims=nothing,
                          axis_args=Dict{Symbol,Any}(), it=nothing, ir=nothing, iz=nothing,
                          ivperp=nothing, ivpa=nothing, ivzeta=nothing, ivr=nothing,
                          ivz=nothing, kwargs...)

                          input=nothing, frame_index=nothing, ax=nothing,
                          fig=nothing, outfile=nothing, yscale=nothing,

                            input=nothing, frame_index=nothing, ax=nothing,
                            fig=nothing, colorbar_place=colorbar_place,

                            it=nothing, ir=nothing, iz=nothing, ivperp=nothing,
                            ivpa=nothing, ivzeta=nothing, ivr=nothing, ivz=nothing,
                            kwargs...)

Animate var_name from the run(s) represented by run_info (as returned by get_run_info) along vz vs vperp and r.

If a Vector of run_info is passed, the animations from each run are created in a horizontal row, with each sub-animation having the 'run name' as its subtitle.

it, is, ir, iz, ivperp, ivpa, ivzeta, ivr, and ivz can be used to select different indices (for non-plotted dimensions) or range (for the plotted dimension, except it which is not compatible as a plotted dimension) to use.

colorscale can be used to set the scaling function for the colors. Options are identity, log, log2, log10, sqrt, Makie.logit, Makie.pseudolog10 and Makie.Symlog10. transform is a function that is applied element-by-element to the data before it is plotted. For example when using a log scale on data that may contain some negative values it might be useful to pass transform=abs (to plot the absolute value) or transform=positive_or_nan (to ignore any negative or zero values).

axis_args are passed as keyword arguments to get_2d_ax(), and from there to the Axis constructor.

Extra kwargs are passed to Makie's heatmap!() function.

When a single run_info is passed, an Axis can be passed to ax. If it is, the plot will be created in ax. When ax is passed, a colorbar will be created at colorbar_place if a GridPosition is passed to colorbar_place.

outfile is required for animations unless ax is passed. The animation will be saved to a file named outfile. The suffix determines the file type. If both outfile and ax are passed, then the Figure containing ax must be passed to fig to allow the animation to be saved.

When a single run_info is passed, the (sub-)title can be set with the title argument.

By default the data for the variable is loaded from the output represented by run_info. The data can optionally be passed to data if you have already loaded it.

Returns the Figure, unless ax was passed in which case returns nothing.

By default relevant settings are read from the var_name section of input_dict_dfns (if output that has distribution functions is being read) or input_dict (otherwise). The settings can also be passed as an AbstractDict or NamedTuple via the input argument. Sometimes needed, for example if var_name is not present in input_dict (in which case you would have had to create the array to be plotted and pass it to data).

source
makie_post_processing.iterate_along_vz_vs_vperp_vpa — Function
iterate_along_vz_vs_vperp_vpa(run_info::Vector{Any}, var_name; is=1, data=nothing,
                              input=nothing, outfile=nothing, colorscale=identity,
                              transform=identity, axis_args=Dict{Symbol,Any}(),
                              it=nothing, ir=nothing, iz=nothing, ivperp=nothing,
                              ivpa=nothing, ivzeta=nothing, ivr=nothing, ivz=nothing,
                              kwargs...)
iterate_along_vz_vs_vperp_vpa(run_info, var_name; is=1, data=nothing,
                              input=nothing, frame_index=nothing, ax=nothing,
                              fig=nothing, colorbar_place=colorbar_place,
                              title=nothing, outfile=nothing, colorscale=identity,
                              transform=identity, axis_args=Dict{Symbol,Any}(),
                              it=nothing, ir=nothing, iz=nothing, ivperp=nothing,
                              ivpa=nothing, ivzeta=nothing, ivr=nothing, ivz=nothing,
                              kwargs...)

Animate var_name from the run(s) represented by run_info (as returned by get_run_info) along vz vs vperp and vpa.

If a Vector of run_info is passed, the animations from each run are created in a horizontal row, with each sub-animation having the 'run name' as its subtitle.

it, is, ir, iz, ivperp, ivpa, ivzeta, ivr, and ivz can be used to select different indices (for non-plotted dimensions) or range (for the plotted dimension, except it which is not compatible as a plotted dimension) to use.

colorscale can be used to set the scaling function for the colors. Options are identity, log, log2, log10, sqrt, Makie.logit, Makie.pseudolog10 and Makie.Symlog10. transform is a function that is applied element-by-element to the data before it is plotted. For example when using a log scale on data that may contain some negative values it might be useful to pass transform=abs (to plot the absolute value) or transform=positive_or_nan (to ignore any negative or zero values).

axis_args are passed as keyword arguments to get_2d_ax(), and from there to the Axis constructor.

Extra kwargs are passed to Makie's heatmap!() function.

When a single run_info is passed, an Axis can be passed to ax. If it is, the plot will be created in ax. When ax is passed, a colorbar will be created at colorbar_place if a GridPosition is passed to colorbar_place.

By default the data for the variable is loaded from the output represented by run_info. The data can optionally be passed to data if you have already loaded it.

Returns the Figure, unless ax was passed in which case returns nothing.

By default relevant settings are read from the var_name section of input_dict_dfns (if output that has distribution functions is being read) or input_dict (otherwise). The settings can also be passed as an AbstractDict or NamedTuple via the input argument. Sometimes needed, for example if var_name is not present in input_dict (in which case you would have had to create the array to be plotted and pass it to data).

makie_post_processing.iterate_along_vz_vs_vperp_z — Function
iterate_along_vz_vs_vperp_z(run_info::Vector{Any}, var_name; is=1, data=nothing,
                            input=nothing, outfile=nothing, colorscale=identity,
                            transform=identity, axis_args=Dict{Symbol,Any}(),
                            it=nothing, ir=nothing, iz=nothing, ivperp=nothing,
                            ivpa=nothing, ivzeta=nothing, ivr=nothing, ivz=nothing,
                            kwargs...)
iterate_along_vz_vs_vperp_z(run_info, var_name; is=1, data=nothing,

                            it=nothing, ir=nothing, iz=nothing, ivperp=nothing,

                            kwargs...)

Animate var_name from the run(s) represented by run_info (as returned by get_run_info) along vz vs vperp and z.

If a Vector of run_info is passed, the animations from each run are created in a horizontal row, with each sub-animation having the 'run name' as its subtitle.

it, is, ir, iz, ivperp, ivpa, ivzeta, ivr, and ivz can be used to select different indices (for non-plotted dimensions) or range (for the plotted dimension, except it which is not compatible as a plotted dimension) to use.

Options are identity, log, log2, log10, sqrt, Makie.logit, Makie.pseudolog10 and Makie.Symlog10. transform is a function that is applied element-by-element to the data before it is plotted. For example when using a log scale on data that may contain some negative values it might be useful to pass transform=abs (to plot the absolute value) or transform=positive_or_nan (to ignore any negative or zero values).

Extra kwargs are passed to Makie's heatmap!() function.

source
makie_post_processing.iterate_along_vz_vs_vr — Function
iterate_along_vz_vs_vr(run_info::Vector{Any}, var_name; is=1, data=nothing,
                       input=nothing, outfile=nothing, yscale=nothing,
                       transform=identity, ylims=nothing,
                       axis_args=Dict{Symbol,Any}(), it=nothing, ir=nothing, iz=nothing,
                       ivperp=nothing, ivpa=nothing, ivzeta=nothing, ivr=nothing,
                       ivz=nothing, kwargs...)
iterate_along_vz_vs_vr(run_info, var_name; is=1, data=nothing,
                       input=nothing, frame_index=nothing, ax=nothing,
                       fig=nothing, outfile=nothing, yscale=nothing,
                       transform=identity, ylims=nothing, label=nothing,
                       axis_args=Dict{Symbol,Any}(), it=nothing, ir=nothing, iz=nothing,
                       ivperp=nothing, ivpa=nothing, ivzeta=nothing, ivr=nothing,
                       ivz=nothing, kwargs...)

Animate var_name from the run(s) represented by run_info (as returned by get_run_info) along vz vs vr.

If a Vector of run_info is passed, the animations from each run are overlayed on the same axis, and a legend is added.

it, is, ir, iz, ivperp, ivpa, ivzeta, ivr, and ivz can be used to select different indices (for non-plotted dimensions) or range (for the plotted dimension, except it which is not compatible as a plotted dimension) to use.

ylims can be passed a Tuple (ymin, ymax) to set the y-axis limits. By default the minimum and maximum of the data (over all time points) will be used.

yscale can be used to set the scaling function for the y-axis. Options are identity, log, log2, log10, sqrt, Makie.logit, Makie.pseudolog10 and Makie.Symlog10. transform is a function that is applied element-by-element to the data before it is plotted. For example when using a log scale on data that may contain some negative values it might be useful to pass transform=abs (to plot the absolute value) or transform=positive_or_nan (to ignore any negative or zero values).

axis_args are passed as keyword arguments to get_1d_ax(), and from there to the Axis constructor.

Extra kwargs are passed to Makie's lines!() function.

When a single run_info is passed, an Axis can be passed to ax. If it is, the plot will be added to ax.

When a single run_info is passed, label can be passed to set a custom label for the line. By default the run_info.run_name is used.

outfile is required for animations unless ax is passed. The animation will be saved to a file named outfile. The suffix determines the file type. If both outfile and ax are passed, then the Figure containing ax must be passed to fig to allow the animation to be saved.

By default the data for the variable is loaded from the output represented by run_info. The data can optionally be passed to data if you have already loaded it.

Returns the Figure, unless ax was passed in which case returns nothing.

By default relevant settings are read from the var_name section of input_dict_dfns (if output that has distribution functions is being read) or input_dict (otherwise). The settings can also be passed as an AbstractDict or NamedTuple via the input argument. Sometimes needed, for example if var_name is not present in input_dict (in which case you would have had to create the array to be plotted and pass it to data).

source
makie_post_processing.iterate_along_vz_vs_vr_r — Function
iterate_along_vz_vs_vr_r(run_info::Vector{Any}, var_name; is=1, data=nothing,
                         input=nothing, outfile=nothing, colorscale=identity,
                         transform=identity, axis_args=Dict{Symbol,Any}(),
                         it=nothing, ir=nothing, iz=nothing, ivperp=nothing,
                         ivpa=nothing, ivzeta=nothing, ivr=nothing, ivz=nothing,
                         kwargs...)
iterate_along_vz_vs_vr_r(run_info, var_name; is=1, data=nothing,
                         input=nothing, frame_index=nothing, ax=nothing,
                         fig=nothing, colorbar_place=colorbar_place,
                         title=nothing, outfile=nothing, colorscale=identity,
                         transform=identity, axis_args=Dict{Symbol,Any}(),
                         it=nothing, ir=nothing, iz=nothing, ivperp=nothing,
                         ivpa=nothing, ivzeta=nothing, ivr=nothing, ivz=nothing,
                         kwargs...)

                             kwargs...)
iterate_along_vz_vs_vr_vzeta(run_info, var_name; is=1, data=nothing,
                             input=nothing, frame_index=nothing, ax=nothing,
                             fig=nothing, colorbar_place=colorbar_place,
                             title=nothing, outfile=nothing, colorscale=identity,
                             transform=identity, axis_args=Dict{Symbol,Any}(),
                             it=nothing, ir=nothing, iz=nothing, ivperp=nothing,
                             ivpa=nothing, ivzeta=nothing, ivr=nothing, ivz=nothing,
                             kwargs...)

Animate var_name from the run(s) represented by run_info (as returned by get_run_info) along vz vs vr and vzeta.

If a Vector of run_info is passed, the animations from each run are created in a horizontal row, with each sub-animation having the 'run name' as its subtitle.

it, is, ir, iz, ivperp, ivpa, ivzeta, ivr, and ivz can be used to select different indices (for non-plotted dimensions) or range (for the plotted dimension, except it which is not compatible as a plotted dimension) to use.

colorscale can be used to set the scaling function for the colors. Options are identity, log, log2, log10, sqrt, Makie.logit, Makie.pseudolog10 and Makie.Symlog10. transform is a function that is applied element-by-element to the data before it is plotted. For example when using a log scale on data that may contain some negative values it might be useful to pass transform=abs (to plot the absolute value) or transform=positive_or_nan (to ignore any negative or zero values).

axis_args are passed as keyword arguments to get_2d_ax(), and from there to the Axis constructor.

Extra kwargs are passed to Makie's heatmap!() function.

When a single run_info is passed, an Axis can be passed to ax. If it is, the plot will be created in ax. When ax is passed, a colorbar will be created at colorbar_place if a GridPosition is passed to colorbar_place.

outfile is required for animations unless ax is passed. The animation will be saved to a file named outfile. The suffix determines the file type. If both outfile and ax are passed, then the Figure containing ax must be passed to fig to allow the animation to be saved.

When a single run_info is passed, the (sub-)title can be set with the title argument.

By default the data for the variable is loaded from the output represented by run_info. The data can optionally be passed to data if you have already loaded it.

Returns the Figure, unless ax was passed in which case returns nothing.

By default relevant settings are read from the var_name section of input_dict_dfns (if output that has distribution functions is being read) or input_dict (otherwise). The settings can also be passed as an AbstractDict or NamedTuple via the input argument. Sometimes needed, for example if var_name is not present in input_dict (in which case you would have had to create the array to be plotted and pass it to data).

source
makie_post_processing.iterate_along_vz_vs_vr_z — Function
iterate_along_vz_vs_vr_z(run_info::Vector{Any}, var_name; is=1, data=nothing,
                         input=nothing, outfile=nothing, colorscale=identity,
                         transform=identity, axis_args=Dict{Symbol,Any}(),
                         it=nothing, ir=nothing, iz=nothing, ivperp=nothing,
                         ivpa=nothing, ivzeta=nothing, ivr=nothing, ivz=nothing,
                         kwargs...)
iterate_along_vz_vs_vr_z(run_info, var_name; is=1, data=nothing,
                         input=nothing, frame_index=nothing, ax=nothing,
                         fig=nothing, colorbar_place=colorbar_place,
                         title=nothing, outfile=nothing, colorscale=identity,
                         transform=identity, axis_args=Dict{Symbol,Any}(),
                         it=nothing, ir=nothing, iz=nothing, ivperp=nothing,
                         ivpa=nothing, ivzeta=nothing, ivr=nothing, ivz=nothing,
                         kwargs...)

Animate var_name from the run(s) represented by run_info (as returned by get_run_info) along vz vs vr and z.

If a Vector of run_info is passed, the animations from each run are created in a horizontal row, with each sub-animation having the 'run name' as its subtitle.

it, is, ir, iz, ivperp, ivpa, ivzeta, ivr, and ivz can be used to select different indices (for non-plotted dimensions) or range (for the plotted dimension, except it which is not compatible as a plotted dimension) to use.

colorscale can be used to set the scaling function for the colors. Options are identity, log, log2, log10, sqrt, Makie.logit, Makie.pseudolog10 and Makie.Symlog10. transform is a function that is applied element-by-element to the data before it is plotted. For example when using a log scale on data that may contain some negative values it might be useful to pass transform=abs (to plot the absolute value) or transform=positive_or_nan (to ignore any negative or zero values).

axis_args are passed as keyword arguments to get_2d_ax(), and from there to the Axis constructor.

Extra kwargs are passed to Makie's heatmap!() function.

When a single run_info is passed, an Axis can be passed to ax. If it is, the plot will be created in ax. When ax is passed, a colorbar will be created at colorbar_place if a GridPosition is passed to colorbar_place.

outfile is required for animations unless ax is passed. The animation will be saved to a file named outfile. The suffix determines the file type. If both outfile and ax are passed, then the Figure containing ax must be passed to fig to allow the animation to be saved.

When a single run_info is passed, the (sub-)title can be set with the title argument.

By default the data for the variable is loaded from the output represented by run_info. The data can optionally be passed to data if you have already loaded it.

Returns the Figure, unless ax was passed in which case returns nothing.

By default relevant settings are read from the var_name section of input_dict_dfns (if output that has distribution functions is being read) or input_dict (otherwise). The settings can also be passed as an AbstractDict or NamedTuple via the input argument. Sometimes needed, for example if var_name is not present in input_dict (in which case you would have had to create the array to be plotted and pass it to data).

source
makie_post_processing.iterate_along_vz_vs_vzeta — Function
iterate_along_vz_vs_vzeta(run_info::Vector{Any}, var_name; is=1, data=nothing,
                          input=nothing, outfile=nothing, yscale=nothing,
                          transform=identity, ylims=nothing,
                          axis_args=Dict{Symbol,Any}(), it=nothing, ir=nothing, iz=nothing,
                          ivperp=nothing, ivpa=nothing, ivzeta=nothing, ivr=nothing,
                          ivz=nothing, kwargs...)
iterate_along_vz_vs_vzeta(run_info, var_name; is=1, data=nothing,
                          input=nothing, frame_index=nothing, ax=nothing,
                          fig=nothing, outfile=nothing, yscale=nothing,
                          transform=identity, ylims=nothing, label=nothing,
                          axis_args=Dict{Symbol,Any}(), it=nothing, ir=nothing, iz=nothing,
                          ivperp=nothing, ivpa=nothing, ivzeta=nothing, ivr=nothing,
                          ivz=nothing, kwargs...)

Animate var_name from the run(s) represented by run_info (as returned by get_run_info) along vz vs vzeta.

If a Vector of run_info is passed, the animations from each run are overlayed on the same axis, and a legend is added.

it, is, ir, iz, ivperp, ivpa, ivzeta, ivr, and ivz can be used to select different indices (for non-plotted dimensions) or range (for the plotted dimension, except it which is not compatible as a plotted dimension) to use.

ylims can be passed a Tuple (ymin, ymax) to set the y-axis limits. By default the minimum and maximum of the data (over all time points) will be used.

yscale can be used to set the scaling function for the y-axis. Options are identity, log, log2, log10, sqrt, Makie.logit, Makie.pseudolog10 and Makie.Symlog10. transform is a function that is applied element-by-element to the data before it is plotted. For example when using a log scale on data that may contain some negative values it might be useful to pass transform=abs (to plot the absolute value) or transform=positive_or_nan (to ignore any negative or zero values).

axis_args are passed as keyword arguments to get_1d_ax(), and from there to the Axis constructor.

Extra kwargs are passed to Makie's lines!() function.

When a single run_info is passed, an Axis can be passed to ax. If it is, the plot will be added to ax.

When a single run_info is passed, label can be passed to set a custom label for the line. By default the run_info.run_name is used.

outfile is required for animations unless ax is passed. The animation will be saved to a file named outfile. The suffix determines the file type. If both outfile and ax are passed, then the Figure containing ax must be passed to fig to allow the animation to be saved.

By default the data for the variable is loaded from the output represented by run_info. The data can optionally be passed to data if you have already loaded it.

Returns the Figure, unless ax was passed in which case returns nothing.

By default relevant settings are read from the var_name section of input_dict_dfns (if output that has distribution functions is being read) or input_dict (otherwise). The settings can also be passed as an AbstractDict or NamedTuple via the input argument. Sometimes needed, for example if var_name is not present in input_dict (in which case you would have had to create the array to be plotted and pass it to data).

source
makie_post_processing.iterate_along_vz_vs_vzeta_r — Function

                            input=nothing, outfile=nothing, colorscale=identity,

                            fig=nothing, colorbar_place=colorbar_place,

                            ivpa=nothing, ivzeta=nothing, ivr=nothing, ivz=nothing,
                            kwargs...)

                      input=nothing, outfile=nothing, yscale=nothing,
                      transform=identity, ylims=nothing,
                      axis_args=Dict{Symbol,Any}(), it=nothing, ir=nothing, iz=nothing,
                      ivperp=nothing, ivpa=nothing, ivzeta=nothing, ivr=nothing,
                      ivz=nothing, kwargs...)

                      input=nothing, frame_index=nothing, ax=nothing,
                      fig=nothing, outfile=nothing, yscale=nothing,
                      transform=identity, ylims=nothing, label=nothing,

                      ivperp=nothing, ivpa=nothing, ivzeta=nothing, ivr=nothing,
                      ivz=nothing, kwargs...)

                        input=nothing, frame_index=nothing, ax=nothing,
                        fig=nothing, colorbar_place=colorbar_place,
                        title=nothing, outfile=nothing, colorscale=identity,
                        transform=identity, axis_args=Dict{Symbol,Any}(),
                        it=nothing, ir=nothing, iz=nothing, ivperp=nothing,
                        ivpa=nothing, ivzeta=nothing, ivr=nothing, ivz=nothing,
                        kwargs...)

Animate var_name from the run(s) represented by run_info (as returned by get_run_info) along vz vs z and r.

If a Vector of run_info is passed, the animations from each run are created in a horizontal row, with each sub-animation having the 'run name' as its subtitle.

it, is, ir, iz, ivperp, ivpa, ivzeta, ivr, and ivz can be used to select different indices (for non-plotted dimensions) or range (for the plotted dimension, except it which is not compatible as a plotted dimension) to use.

colorscale can be used to set the scaling function for the colors. Options are identity, log, log2, log10, sqrt, Makie.logit, Makie.pseudolog10 and Makie.Symlog10. transform is a function that is applied element-by-element to the data before it is plotted. For example when using a log scale on data that may contain some negative values it might be useful to pass transform=abs (to plot the absolute value) or transform=positive_or_nan (to ignore any negative or zero values).

axis_args are passed as keyword arguments to get_2d_ax(), and from there to the Axis constructor.

Extra kwargs are passed to Makie's heatmap!() function.

When a single run_info is passed, an Axis can be passed to ax. If it is, the plot will be created in ax. When ax is passed, a colorbar will be created at colorbar_place if a GridPosition is passed to colorbar_place.

outfile is required for animations unless ax is passed. The animation will be saved to a file named outfile. The suffix determines the file type. If both outfile and ax are passed, then the Figure containing ax must be passed to fig to allow the animation to be saved.

When a single run_info is passed, the (sub-)title can be set with the title argument.

By default the data for the variable is loaded from the output represented by run_info. The data can optionally be passed to data if you have already loaded it.

Returns the Figure, unless ax was passed in which case returns nothing.

By default relevant settings are read from the var_name section of input_dict_dfns (if output that has distribution functions is being read) or input_dict (otherwise). The settings can also be passed as an AbstractDict or NamedTuple via the input argument. Sometimes needed, for example if var_name is not present in input_dict (in which case you would have had to create the array to be plotted and pass it to data).

source
makie_post_processing.iterate_along_vz_vs_z_vpa — Function
iterate_along_vz_vs_z_vpa(run_info::Vector{Any}, var_name; is=1, data=nothing,
                          input=nothing, outfile=nothing, colorscale=identity,
                          transform=identity, axis_args=Dict{Symbol,Any}(),
                          it=nothing, ir=nothing, iz=nothing, ivperp=nothing,
                          ivpa=nothing, ivzeta=nothing, ivr=nothing, ivz=nothing,
                          kwargs...)
iterate_along_vz_vs_z_vpa(run_info, var_name; is=1, data=nothing,
                          input=nothing, frame_index=nothing, ax=nothing,
                          fig=nothing, colorbar_place=colorbar_place,
                          title=nothing, outfile=nothing, colorscale=identity,
                          transform=identity, axis_args=Dict{Symbol,Any}(),
                          it=nothing, ir=nothing, iz=nothing, ivperp=nothing,
                          ivpa=nothing, ivzeta=nothing, ivr=nothing, ivz=nothing,
                          kwargs...)

Animate var_name from the run(s) represented by run_info (as returned by get_run_info) along vz vs z and vpa.

If a Vector of run_info is passed, the animations from each run are created in a horizontal row, with each sub-animation having the 'run name' as its subtitle.

it, is, ir, iz, ivperp, ivpa, ivzeta, ivr, and ivz can be used to select different indices (for non-plotted dimensions) or range (for the plotted dimension, except it which is not compatible as a plotted dimension) to use.

colorscale can be used to set the scaling function for the colors. Options are identity, log, log2, log10, sqrt, Makie.logit, Makie.pseudolog10 and Makie.Symlog10. transform is a function that is applied element-by-element to the data before it is plotted. For example when using a log scale on data that may contain some negative values it might be useful to pass transform=abs (to plot the absolute value) or transform=positive_or_nan (to ignore any negative or zero values).

axis_args are passed as keyword arguments to get_2d_ax(), and from there to the Axis constructor.

Extra kwargs are passed to Makie's heatmap!() function.

When a single run_info is passed, an Axis can be passed to ax. If it is, the plot will be created in ax. When ax is passed, a colorbar will be created at colorbar_place if a GridPosition is passed to colorbar_place.

outfile is required for animations unless ax is passed. The animation will be saved to a file named outfile. The suffix determines the file type. If both outfile and ax are passed, then the Figure containing ax must be passed to fig to allow the animation to be saved.

When a single run_info is passed, the (sub-)title can be set with the title argument.

By default the data for the variable is loaded from the output represented by run_info. The data can optionally be passed to data if you have already loaded it.

Returns the Figure, unless ax was passed in which case returns nothing.

By default relevant settings are read from the var_name section of input_dict_dfns (if output that has distribution functions is being read) or input_dict (otherwise). The settings can also be passed as an AbstractDict or NamedTuple via the input argument. Sometimes needed, for example if var_name is not present in input_dict (in which case you would have had to create the array to be plotted and pass it to data).

                            input=nothing, outfile=nothing, colorscale=identity,
                            transform=identity, axis_args=Dict{Symbol,Any}(),
                            it=nothing, ir=nothing, iz=nothing, ivperp=nothing,
                            ivpa=nothing, ivzeta=nothing, ivr=nothing, ivz=nothing,

                            kwargs...)

source
makie_post_processing.iterate_along_vzeta_vs_r — Function
iterate_along_vzeta_vs_r(run_info::Vector{Any}, var_name; is=1, data=nothing,
                         input=nothing, outfile=nothing, yscale=nothing,
                         transform=identity, ylims=nothing,
                         axis_args=Dict{Symbol,Any}(), it=nothing, ir=nothing, iz=nothing,
                         ivperp=nothing, ivpa=nothing, ivzeta=nothing, ivr=nothing,
                         ivz=nothing, kwargs...)
iterate_along_vzeta_vs_r(run_info, var_name; is=1, data=nothing,
                         input=nothing, frame_index=nothing, ax=nothing,
                         fig=nothing, outfile=nothing, yscale=nothing,
                         transform=identity, ylims=nothing, label=nothing,
                         axis_args=Dict{Symbol,Any}(), it=nothing, ir=nothing, iz=nothing,
                         ivperp=nothing, ivpa=nothing, ivzeta=nothing, ivr=nothing,
                         ivz=nothing, kwargs...)

Animate var_name from the run(s) represented by run_info (as returned by get_run_info) along vzeta vs r.

If a Vector of run_info is passed, the animations from each run are overlayed on the same axis, and a legend is added.

it, is, ir, iz, ivperp, ivpa, ivzeta, ivr, and ivz can be used to select different indices (for non-plotted dimensions) or range (for the plotted dimension, except it which is not compatible as a plotted dimension) to use.

ylims can be passed a Tuple (ymin, ymax) to set the y-axis limits. By default the minimum and maximum of the data (over all time points) will be used.

yscale can be used to set the scaling function for the y-axis. Options are identity, log, log2, log10, sqrt, Makie.logit, Makie.pseudolog10 and Makie.Symlog10. transform is a function that is applied element-by-element to the data before it is plotted. For example when using a log scale on data that may contain some negative values it might be useful to pass transform=abs (to plot the absolute value) or transform=positive_or_nan (to ignore any negative or zero values).

axis_args are passed as keyword arguments to get_1d_ax(), and from there to the Axis constructor.

Extra kwargs are passed to Makie's lines!() function.

When a single run_info is passed, an Axis can be passed to ax. If it is, the plot will be added to ax.

When a single run_info is passed, label can be passed to set a custom label for the line. By default the run_info.run_name is used.

outfile is required for animations unless ax is passed. The animation will be saved to a file named outfile. The suffix determines the file type. If both outfile and ax are passed, then the Figure containing ax must be passed to fig to allow the animation to be saved.

By default the data for the variable is loaded from the output represented by run_info. The data can optionally be passed to data if you have already loaded it.

Returns the Figure, unless ax was passed in which case returns nothing.

By default relevant settings are read from the var_name section of input_dict_dfns (if output that has distribution functions is being read) or input_dict (otherwise). The settings can also be passed as an AbstractDict or NamedTuple via the input argument. Sometimes needed, for example if var_name is not present in input_dict (in which case you would have had to create the array to be plotted and pass it to data).

source
makie_post_processing.iterate_along_vzeta_vs_r_vpa — Function
iterate_along_vzeta_vs_r_vpa(run_info::Vector{Any}, var_name; is=1, data=nothing,
                             input=nothing, outfile=nothing, colorscale=identity,
                             transform=identity, axis_args=Dict{Symbol,Any}(),
                             it=nothing, ir=nothing, iz=nothing, ivperp=nothing,
                             ivpa=nothing, ivzeta=nothing, ivr=nothing, ivz=nothing,
                             kwargs...)
iterate_along_vzeta_vs_r_vpa(run_info, var_name; is=1, data=nothing,
                             input=nothing, frame_index=nothing, ax=nothing,
                             fig=nothing, colorbar_place=colorbar_place,
                             title=nothing, outfile=nothing, colorscale=identity,
                             transform=identity, axis_args=Dict{Symbol,Any}(),
                             it=nothing, ir=nothing, iz=nothing, ivperp=nothing,
                             ivpa=nothing, ivzeta=nothing, ivr=nothing, ivz=nothing,
                             kwargs...)

                            transform=identity, axis_args=Dict{Symbol,Any}(),
                            it=nothing, ir=nothing, iz=nothing, ivperp=nothing,
                            ivpa=nothing, ivzeta=nothing, ivr=nothing, ivz=nothing,
                            kwargs...)
iterate_along_vzeta_vs_r_vz(run_info, var_name; is=1, data=nothing,
                            input=nothing, frame_index=nothing, ax=nothing,
                            fig=nothing, colorbar_place=colorbar_place,
                            title=nothing, outfile=nothing, colorscale=identity,
                            transform=identity, axis_args=Dict{Symbol,Any}(),
                            it=nothing, ir=nothing, iz=nothing, ivperp=nothing,
                            ivpa=nothing, ivzeta=nothing, ivr=nothing, ivz=nothing,
                            kwargs...)

Animate var_name from the run(s) represented by run_info (as returned by get_run_info) along vzeta vs r and vz.

If a Vector of run_info is passed, the animations from each run are created in a horizontal row, with each sub-animation having the 'run name' as its subtitle.

it, is, ir, iz, ivperp, ivpa, ivzeta, ivr, and ivz can be used to select different indices (for non-plotted dimensions) or range (for the plotted dimension, except it which is not compatible as a plotted dimension) to use.

colorscale can be used to set the scaling function for the colors. Options are identity, log, log2, log10, sqrt, Makie.logit, Makie.pseudolog10 and Makie.Symlog10. transform is a function that is applied element-by-element to the data before it is plotted. For example when using a log scale on data that may contain some negative values it might be useful to pass transform=abs (to plot the absolute value) or transform=positive_or_nan (to ignore any negative or zero values).

axis_args are passed as keyword arguments to get_2d_ax(), and from there to the Axis constructor.

Extra kwargs are passed to Makie's heatmap!() function.

When a single run_info is passed, an Axis can be passed to ax. If it is, the plot will be created in ax. When ax is passed, a colorbar will be created at colorbar_place if a GridPosition is passed to colorbar_place.

outfile is required for animations unless ax is passed. The animation will be saved to a file named outfile. The suffix determines the file type. If both outfile and ax are passed, then the Figure containing ax must be passed to fig to allow the animation to be saved.

When a single run_info is passed, the (sub-)title can be set with the title argument.

By default the data for the variable is loaded from the output represented by run_info. The data can optionally be passed to data if you have already loaded it.

Returns the Figure, unless ax was passed in which case returns nothing.

By default relevant settings are read from the var_name section of input_dict_dfns (if output that has distribution functions is being read) or input_dict (otherwise). The settings can also be passed as an AbstractDict or NamedTuple via the input argument. Sometimes needed, for example if var_name is not present in input_dict (in which case you would have had to create the array to be plotted and pass it to data).

source
makie_post_processing.iterate_along_vzeta_vs_r_z — Function
iterate_along_vzeta_vs_r_z(run_info::Vector{Any}, var_name; is=1, data=nothing,
                           input=nothing, outfile=nothing, colorscale=identity,
                           transform=identity, axis_args=Dict{Symbol,Any}(),
                           it=nothing, ir=nothing, iz=nothing, ivperp=nothing,
                           ivpa=nothing, ivzeta=nothing, ivr=nothing, ivz=nothing,
                           kwargs...)
iterate_along_vzeta_vs_r_z(run_info, var_name; is=1, data=nothing,
                           input=nothing, frame_index=nothing, ax=nothing,
                           fig=nothing, colorbar_place=colorbar_place,
                           title=nothing, outfile=nothing, colorscale=identity,
                           transform=identity, axis_args=Dict{Symbol,Any}(),
                           it=nothing, ir=nothing, iz=nothing, ivperp=nothing,
                           ivpa=nothing, ivzeta=nothing, ivr=nothing, ivz=nothing,
                           kwargs...)

Animate var_name from the run(s) represented by run_info (as returned by get_run_info) along vzeta vs r and z.

If a Vector of run_info is passed, the animations from each run are created in a horizontal row, with each sub-animation having the 'run name' as its subtitle.

it, is, ir, iz, ivperp, ivpa, ivzeta, ivr, and ivz can be used to select different indices (for non-plotted dimensions) or range (for the plotted dimension, except it which is not compatible as a plotted dimension) to use.

colorscale can be used to set the scaling function for the colors. Options are identity, log, log2, log10, sqrt, Makie.logit, Makie.pseudolog10 and Makie.Symlog10. transform is a function that is applied element-by-element to the data before it is plotted. For example when using a log scale on data that may contain some negative values it might be useful to pass transform=abs (to plot the absolute value) or transform=positive_or_nan (to ignore any negative or zero values).

axis_args are passed as keyword arguments to get_2d_ax(), and from there to the Axis constructor.

Extra kwargs are passed to Makie's heatmap!() function.

When a single run_info is passed, an Axis can be passed to ax. If it is, the plot will be created in ax. When ax is passed, a colorbar will be created at colorbar_place if a GridPosition is passed to colorbar_place.

outfile is required for animations unless ax is passed. The animation will be saved to a file named outfile. The suffix determines the file type. If both outfile and ax are passed, then the Figure containing ax must be passed to fig to allow the animation to be saved.

When a single run_info is passed, the (sub-)title can be set with the title argument.

By default the data for the variable is loaded from the output represented by run_info. The data can optionally be passed to data if you have already loaded it.

Returns the Figure, unless ax was passed in which case returns nothing.

By default relevant settings are read from the var_name section of input_dict_dfns (if output that has distribution functions is being read) or input_dict (otherwise). The settings can also be passed as an AbstractDict or NamedTuple via the input argument. Sometimes needed, for example if var_name is not present in input_dict (in which case you would have had to create the array to be plotted and pass it to data).

source
makie_post_processing.iterate_along_vzeta_vs_vpa — Function
iterate_along_vzeta_vs_vpa(run_info::Vector{Any}, var_name; is=1, data=nothing,
                           input=nothing, outfile=nothing, yscale=nothing,
                           transform=identity, ylims=nothing,
                           axis_args=Dict{Symbol,Any}(), it=nothing, ir=nothing, iz=nothing,
                           ivperp=nothing, ivpa=nothing, ivzeta=nothing, ivr=nothing,
                           ivz=nothing, kwargs...)
iterate_along_vzeta_vs_vpa(run_info, var_name; is=1, data=nothing,
                           input=nothing, frame_index=nothing, ax=nothing,
                           fig=nothing, outfile=nothing, yscale=nothing,
                           transform=identity, ylims=nothing, label=nothing,
                           axis_args=Dict{Symbol,Any}(), it=nothing, ir=nothing, iz=nothing,
                           ivperp=nothing, ivpa=nothing, ivzeta=nothing, ivr=nothing,
                           ivz=nothing, kwargs...)

Animate var_name from the run(s) represented by run_info (as returned by get_run_info) along vzeta vs vpa.

If a Vector of run_info is passed, the animations from each run are overlayed on the same axis, and a legend is added.

it, is, ir, iz, ivperp, ivpa, ivzeta, ivr, and ivz can be used to select different indices (for non-plotted dimensions) or range (for the plotted dimension, except it which is not compatible as a plotted dimension) to use.

ylims can be passed a Tuple (ymin, ymax) to set the y-axis limits. By default the minimum and maximum of the data (over all time points) will be used.

yscale can be used to set the scaling function for the y-axis. Options are identity, log, log2, log10, sqrt, Makie.logit, Makie.pseudolog10 and Makie.Symlog10. transform is a function that is applied element-by-element to the data before it is plotted. For example when using a log scale on data that may contain some negative values it might be useful to pass transform=abs (to plot the absolute value) or transform=positive_or_nan (to ignore any negative or zero values).

axis_args are passed as keyword arguments to get_1d_ax(), and from there to the Axis constructor.

Extra kwargs are passed to Makie's lines!() function.

When a single run_info is passed, an Axis can be passed to ax. If it is, the plot will be added to ax.

When a single run_info is passed, label can be passed to set a custom label for the line. By default the run_info.run_name is used.

outfile is required for animations unless ax is passed. The animation will be saved to a file named outfile. The suffix determines the file type. If both outfile and ax are passed, then the Figure containing ax must be passed to fig to allow the animation to be saved.

By default the data for the variable is loaded from the output represented by run_info. The data can optionally be passed to data if you have already loaded it.

Returns the Figure, unless ax was passed in which case returns nothing.

By default relevant settings are read from the var_name section of input_dict_dfns (if output that has distribution functions is being read) or input_dict (otherwise). The settings can also be passed as an AbstractDict or NamedTuple via the input argument. Sometimes needed, for example if var_name is not present in input_dict (in which case you would have had to create the array to be plotted and pass it to data).

source
makie_post_processing.iterate_along_vzeta_vs_vpa_r — Function

                             input=nothing, outfile=nothing, colorscale=identity,
                             transform=identity, axis_args=Dict{Symbol,Any}(),
                             it=nothing, ir=nothing, iz=nothing, ivperp=nothing,
                             ivpa=nothing, ivzeta=nothing, ivr=nothing, ivz=nothing,
                             kwargs...)
iterate_along_vzeta_vs_vpa_r(run_info, var_name; is=1, data=nothing,

                             fig=nothing, colorbar_place=colorbar_place,

                             transform=identity, axis_args=Dict{Symbol,Any}(),
                             it=nothing, ir=nothing, iz=nothing, ivperp=nothing,
                             ivpa=nothing, ivzeta=nothing, ivr=nothing, ivz=nothing,
                             kwargs...)

makie_post_processing.iterate_along_vzeta_vs_vperp_r — Function
iterate_along_vzeta_vs_vperp_r(run_info::Vector{Any}, var_name; is=1, data=nothing,
                               input=nothing, outfile=nothing, colorscale=identity,
                               transform=identity, axis_args=Dict{Symbol,Any}(),
                               it=nothing, ir=nothing, iz=nothing, ivperp=nothing,
                               ivpa=nothing, ivzeta=nothing, ivr=nothing, ivz=nothing,
                               kwargs...)
iterate_along_vzeta_vs_vperp_r(run_info, var_name; is=1, data=nothing,
                               input=nothing, frame_index=nothing, ax=nothing,
                               fig=nothing, colorbar_place=colorbar_place,
                               title=nothing, outfile=nothing, colorscale=identity,
                               transform=identity, axis_args=Dict{Symbol,Any}(),
                               it=nothing, ir=nothing, iz=nothing, ivperp=nothing,
                               ivpa=nothing, ivzeta=nothing, ivr=nothing, ivz=nothing,
                               kwargs...)

Animate var_name from the run(s) represented by run_info (as returned by get_run_info) along vzeta vs vperp and r.

If a Vector of run_info is passed, the animations from each run are created in a horizontal row, with each sub-animation having the 'run name' as its subtitle.

it, is, ir, iz, ivperp, ivpa, ivzeta, ivr, and ivz can be used to select different indices (for non-plotted dimensions) or range (for the plotted dimension, except it which is not compatible as a plotted dimension) to use.

colorscale can be used to set the scaling function for the colors. Options are identity, log, log2, log10, sqrt, Makie.logit, Makie.pseudolog10 and Makie.Symlog10. transform is a function that is applied element-by-element to the data before it is plotted. For example when using a log scale on data that may contain some negative values it might be useful to pass transform=abs (to plot the absolute value) or transform=positive_or_nan (to ignore any negative or zero values).

axis_args are passed as keyword arguments to get_2d_ax(), and from there to the Axis constructor.

Extra kwargs are passed to Makie's heatmap!() function.

When a single run_info is passed, an Axis can be passed to ax. If it is, the plot will be created in ax. When ax is passed, a colorbar will be created at colorbar_place if a GridPosition is passed to colorbar_place.

outfile is required for animations unless ax is passed. The animation will be saved to a file named outfile. The suffix determines the file type. If both outfile and ax are passed, then the Figure containing ax must be passed to fig to allow the animation to be saved.

When a single run_info is passed, the (sub-)title can be set with the title argument.

By default the data for the variable is loaded from the output represented by run_info. The data can optionally be passed to data if you have already loaded it.

Returns the Figure, unless ax was passed in which case returns nothing.

By default relevant settings are read from the var_name section of input_dict_dfns (if output that has distribution functions is being read) or input_dict (otherwise). The settings can also be passed as an AbstractDict or NamedTuple via the input argument. Sometimes needed, for example if var_name is not present in input_dict (in which case you would have had to create the array to be plotted and pass it to data).

source
makie_post_processing.iterate_along_vzeta_vs_vperp_vpa — Function
iterate_along_vzeta_vs_vperp_vpa(run_info::Vector{Any}, var_name; is=1, data=nothing,
                                 input=nothing, outfile=nothing, colorscale=identity,
                                 transform=identity, axis_args=Dict{Symbol,Any}(),
                                 it=nothing, ir=nothing, iz=nothing, ivperp=nothing,
                                 ivpa=nothing, ivzeta=nothing, ivr=nothing, ivz=nothing,
                                 kwargs...)
iterate_along_vzeta_vs_vperp_vpa(run_info, var_name; is=1, data=nothing,
                                 input=nothing, frame_index=nothing, ax=nothing,
                                 fig=nothing, colorbar_place=colorbar_place,
                                 title=nothing, outfile=nothing, colorscale=identity,
                                 transform=identity, axis_args=Dict{Symbol,Any}(),
                                 it=nothing, ir=nothing, iz=nothing, ivperp=nothing,
                                 ivpa=nothing, ivzeta=nothing, ivr=nothing, ivz=nothing,
                                 kwargs...)

Animate var_name from the run(s) represented by run_info (as returned by get_run_info) along vzeta vs vperp and vpa.

colorscale can be used to set the scaling function for the colors. Options are identity, log, log2, log10, sqrt, Makie.logit, Makie.pseudolog10 and Makie.Symlog10. transform is a function that is applied element-by-element to the data before it is plotted. For example when using a log scale on data that may contain some negative values it might be useful to pass transform=abs (to plot the absolute value) or transform=positive_or_nan (to ignore any negative or zero values).

axis_args are passed as keyword arguments to get_2d_ax(), and from there to the Axis constructor.

Extra kwargs are passed to Makie's heatmap!() function.

The settings can also be passed as an AbstractDict or NamedTuple via the input argument. Sometimes needed, for example if var_name is not present in input_dict (in which case you would have had to create the array to be plotted and pass it to data).

                               input=nothing, outfile=nothing, colorscale=identity,
                               transform=identity, axis_args=Dict{Symbol,Any}(),
                               it=nothing, ir=nothing, iz=nothing, ivperp=nothing,
                               ivpa=nothing, ivzeta=nothing, ivr=nothing, ivz=nothing,

source
makie_post_processing.iterate_along_vzeta_vs_vr — Function
iterate_along_vzeta_vs_vr(run_info::Vector{Any}, var_name; is=1, data=nothing,
                          input=nothing, outfile=nothing, yscale=nothing,
                          transform=identity, ylims=nothing,
                          axis_args=Dict{Symbol,Any}(), it=nothing, ir=nothing, iz=nothing,
                          ivperp=nothing, ivpa=nothing, ivzeta=nothing, ivr=nothing,
                          ivz=nothing, kwargs...)
iterate_along_vzeta_vs_vr(run_info, var_name; is=1, data=nothing,
                          input=nothing, frame_index=nothing, ax=nothing,
                          fig=nothing, outfile=nothing, yscale=nothing,
                          transform=identity, ylims=nothing, label=nothing,
                          axis_args=Dict{Symbol,Any}(), it=nothing, ir=nothing, iz=nothing,
                          ivperp=nothing, ivpa=nothing, ivzeta=nothing, ivr=nothing,
                          ivz=nothing, kwargs...)

Animate var_name from the run(s) represented by run_info (as returned by get_run_info) along vzeta vs vr.

If a Vector of run_info is passed, the animations from each run are overlayed on the same axis, and a legend is added.

it, is, ir, iz, ivperp, ivpa, ivzeta, ivr, and ivz can be used to select different indices (for non-plotted dimensions) or range (for the plotted dimension, except it which is not compatible as a plotted dimension) to use.

ylims can be passed a Tuple (ymin, ymax) to set the y-axis limits. By default the minimum and maximum of the data (over all time points) will be used.

yscale can be used to set the scaling function for the y-axis. Options are identity, log, log2, log10, sqrt, Makie.logit, Makie.pseudolog10 and Makie.Symlog10. transform is a function that is applied element-by-element to the data before it is plotted. For example when using a log scale on data that may contain some negative values it might be useful to pass transform=abs (to plot the absolute value) or transform=positive_or_nan (to ignore any negative or zero values).

axis_args are passed as keyword arguments to get_1d_ax(), and from there to the Axis constructor.

Extra kwargs are passed to Makie's lines!() function.

When a single run_info is passed, an Axis can be passed to ax. If it is, the plot will be added to ax.

When a single run_info is passed, label can be passed to set a custom label for the line. By default the run_info.run_name is used.

outfile is required for animations unless ax is passed. The animation will be saved to a file named outfile. The suffix determines the file type. If both outfile and ax are passed, then the Figure containing ax must be passed to fig to allow the animation to be saved.

By default the data for the variable is loaded from the output represented by run_info. The data can optionally be passed to data if you have already loaded it.

Returns the Figure, unless ax was passed in which case returns nothing.

By default relevant settings are read from the var_name section of input_dict_dfns (if output that has distribution functions is being read) or input_dict (otherwise). The settings can also be passed as an AbstractDict or NamedTuple via the input argument. Sometimes needed, for example if var_name is not present in input_dict (in which case you would have had to create the array to be plotted and pass it to data).

source
makie_post_processing.iterate_along_vzeta_vs_vr_r — Function
iterate_along_vzeta_vs_vr_r(run_info::Vector{Any}, var_name; is=1, data=nothing,
                            input=nothing, outfile=nothing, colorscale=identity,
                            transform=identity, axis_args=Dict{Symbol,Any}(),
                            it=nothing, ir=nothing, iz=nothing, ivperp=nothing,
                            ivpa=nothing, ivzeta=nothing, ivr=nothing, ivz=nothing,
                            kwargs...)
iterate_along_vzeta_vs_vr_r(run_info, var_name; is=1, data=nothing,
                            input=nothing, frame_index=nothing, ax=nothing,
                            fig=nothing, colorbar_place=colorbar_place,
                            title=nothing, outfile=nothing, colorscale=identity,
                            transform=identity, axis_args=Dict{Symbol,Any}(),
                            it=nothing, ir=nothing, iz=nothing, ivperp=nothing,
                            ivpa=nothing, ivzeta=nothing, ivr=nothing, ivz=nothing,
                            kwargs...)

makie_post_processing.iterate_along_vzeta_vs_vr_vz — Function
iterate_along_vzeta_vs_vr_vz(run_info::Vector{Any}, var_name; is=1, data=nothing,
                             input=nothing, outfile=nothing, colorscale=identity,
                             transform=identity, axis_args=Dict{Symbol,Any}(),
                             it=nothing, ir=nothing, iz=nothing, ivperp=nothing,
                             ivpa=nothing, ivzeta=nothing, ivr=nothing, ivz=nothing,
                             kwargs...)
iterate_along_vzeta_vs_vr_vz(run_info, var_name; is=1, data=nothing,
                             input=nothing, frame_index=nothing, ax=nothing,
                             fig=nothing, colorbar_place=colorbar_place,
                             title=nothing, outfile=nothing, colorscale=identity,
                             transform=identity, axis_args=Dict{Symbol,Any}(),
                             it=nothing, ir=nothing, iz=nothing, ivperp=nothing,
                             ivpa=nothing, ivzeta=nothing, ivr=nothing, ivz=nothing,
                             kwargs...)

Animate var_name from the run(s) represented by run_info (as returned by get_run_info) along vzeta vs vr and vz.

If a Vector of run_info is passed, the animations from each run are created in a horizontal row, with each sub-animation having the 'run name' as its subtitle.

it, is, ir, iz, ivperp, ivpa, ivzeta, ivr, and ivz can be used to select different indices (for non-plotted dimensions) or range (for the plotted dimension, except it which is not compatible as a plotted dimension) to use.

colorscale can be used to set the scaling function for the colors. Options are identity, log, log2, log10, sqrt, Makie.logit, Makie.pseudolog10 and Makie.Symlog10. transform is a function that is applied element-by-element to the data before it is plotted. For example when using a log scale on data that may contain some negative values it might be useful to pass transform=abs (to plot the absolute value) or transform=positive_or_nan (to ignore any negative or zero values).

axis_args are passed as keyword arguments to get_2d_ax(), and from there to the Axis constructor.

Extra kwargs are passed to Makie's heatmap!() function.

When a single run_info is passed, an Axis can be passed to ax. If it is, the plot will be created in ax. When ax is passed, a colorbar will be created at colorbar_place if a GridPosition is passed to colorbar_place.

outfile is required for animations unless ax is passed. The animation will be saved to a file named outfile. The suffix determines the file type. If both outfile and ax are passed, then the Figure containing ax must be passed to fig to allow the animation to be saved.

When a single run_info is passed, the (sub-)title can be set with the title argument.

By default the data for the variable is loaded from the output represented by run_info. The data can optionally be passed to data if you have already loaded it.

Returns the Figure, unless ax was passed in which case returns nothing.

By default relevant settings are read from the var_name section of input_dict_dfns (if output that has distribution functions is being read) or input_dict (otherwise). The settings can also be passed as an AbstractDict or NamedTuple via the input argument. Sometimes needed, for example if var_name is not present in input_dict (in which case you would have had to create the array to be plotted and pass it to data).

source
makie_post_processing.iterate_along_vzeta_vs_vr_z — Function
iterate_along_vzeta_vs_vr_z(run_info::Vector{Any}, var_name; is=1, data=nothing,
                            input=nothing, outfile=nothing, colorscale=identity,
                            transform=identity, axis_args=Dict{Symbol,Any}(),
                            it=nothing, ir=nothing, iz=nothing, ivperp=nothing,
                            ivpa=nothing, ivzeta=nothing, ivr=nothing, ivz=nothing,
                            kwargs...)
iterate_along_vzeta_vs_vr_z(run_info, var_name; is=1, data=nothing,
                            input=nothing, frame_index=nothing, ax=nothing,
                            fig=nothing, colorbar_place=colorbar_place,
                            title=nothing, outfile=nothing, colorscale=identity,
                            transform=identity, axis_args=Dict{Symbol,Any}(),
                            it=nothing, ir=nothing, iz=nothing, ivperp=nothing,
                            ivpa=nothing, ivzeta=nothing, ivr=nothing, ivz=nothing,
                            kwargs...)

Animate var_name from the run(s) represented by run_info (as returned by get_run_info) along vzeta vs vr and z.

If a Vector of run_info is passed, the animations from each run are created in a horizontal row, with each sub-animation having the 'run name' as its subtitle.

it, is, ir, iz, ivperp, ivpa, ivzeta, ivr, and ivz can be used to select different indices (for non-plotted dimensions) or range (for the plotted dimension, except it which is not compatible as a plotted dimension) to use.

colorscale can be used to set the scaling function for the colors. Options are identity, log, log2, log10, sqrt, Makie.logit, Makie.pseudolog10 and Makie.Symlog10. transform is a function that is applied element-by-element to the data before it is plotted. For example when using a log scale on data that may contain some negative values it might be useful to pass transform=abs (to plot the absolute value) or transform=positive_or_nan (to ignore any negative or zero values).

axis_args are passed as keyword arguments to get_2d_ax(), and from there to the Axis constructor.

Extra kwargs are passed to Makie's heatmap!() function.

When a single run_info is passed, an Axis can be passed to ax. If it is, the plot will be created in ax. When ax is passed, a colorbar will be created at colorbar_place if a GridPosition is passed to colorbar_place.

outfile is required for animations unless ax is passed. The animation will be saved to a file named outfile. The suffix determines the file type. If both outfile and ax are passed, then the Figure containing ax must be passed to fig to allow the animation to be saved.

When a single run_info is passed, the (sub-)title can be set with the title argument.

By default the data for the variable is loaded from the output represented by run_info. The data can optionally be passed to data if you have already loaded it.

Returns the Figure, unless ax was passed in which case returns nothing.

By default relevant settings are read from the var_name section of input_dict_dfns (if output that has distribution functions is being read) or input_dict (otherwise). The settings can also be passed as an AbstractDict or NamedTuple via the input argument. Sometimes needed, for example if var_name is not present in input_dict (in which case you would have had to create the array to be plotted and pass it to data).

source
makie_post_processing.iterate_along_vzeta_vs_vz — Function
iterate_along_vzeta_vs_vz(run_info::Vector{Any}, var_name; is=1, data=nothing,
                          input=nothing, outfile=nothing, yscale=nothing,
                          transform=identity, ylims=nothing,
                          axis_args=Dict{Symbol,Any}(), it=nothing, ir=nothing, iz=nothing,
                          ivperp=nothing, ivpa=nothing, ivzeta=nothing, ivr=nothing,
                          ivz=nothing, kwargs...)
iterate_along_vzeta_vs_vz(run_info, var_name; is=1, data=nothing,
                          input=nothing, frame_index=nothing, ax=nothing,
                          fig=nothing, outfile=nothing, yscale=nothing,
                          transform=identity, ylims=nothing, label=nothing,
                          axis_args=Dict{Symbol,Any}(), it=nothing, ir=nothing, iz=nothing,
                          ivperp=nothing, ivpa=nothing, ivzeta=nothing, ivr=nothing,
                          ivz=nothing, kwargs...)

Animate var_name from the run(s) represented by run_info (as returned by get_run_info) along vzeta vs vz.

If a Vector of run_info is passed, the animations from each run are overlayed on the same axis, and a legend is added.

it, is, ir, iz, ivperp, ivpa, ivzeta, ivr, and ivz can be used to select different indices (for non-plotted dimensions) or range (for the plotted dimension, except it which is not compatible as a plotted dimension) to use.

ylims can be passed a Tuple (ymin, ymax) to set the y-axis limits. By default the minimum and maximum of the data (over all time points) will be used.

yscale can be used to set the scaling function for the y-axis. Options are identity, log, log2, log10, sqrt, Makie.logit, Makie.pseudolog10 and Makie.Symlog10. transform is a function that is applied element-by-element to the data before it is plotted. For example when using a log scale on data that may contain some negative values it might be useful to pass transform=abs (to plot the absolute value) or transform=positive_or_nan (to ignore any negative or zero values).

axis_args are passed as keyword arguments to get_1d_ax(), and from there to the Axis constructor.

Extra kwargs are passed to Makie's lines!() function.

When a single run_info is passed, an Axis can be passed to ax. If it is, the plot will be added to ax.

When a single run_info is passed, label can be passed to set a custom label for the line. By default the run_info.run_name is used.

outfile is required for animations unless ax is passed. The animation will be saved to a file named outfile. The suffix determines the file type. If both outfile and ax are passed, then the Figure containing ax must be passed to fig to allow the animation to be saved.

By default the data for the variable is loaded from the output represented by run_info. The data can optionally be passed to data if you have already loaded it.

Returns the Figure, unless ax was passed in which case returns nothing.

By default relevant settings are read from the var_name section of input_dict_dfns (if output that has distribution functions is being read) or input_dict (otherwise). The settings can also be passed as an AbstractDict or NamedTuple via the input argument. Sometimes needed, for example if var_name is not present in input_dict (in which case you would have had to create the array to be plotted and pass it to data).

source

                            input=nothing, outfile=nothing, colorscale=identity,

                         input=nothing, outfile=nothing, yscale=nothing,
                         transform=identity, ylims=nothing,
                         axis_args=Dict{Symbol,Any}(), it=nothing, ir=nothing, iz=nothing,
                         ivperp=nothing, ivpa=nothing, ivzeta=nothing, ivr=nothing,
                         ivz=nothing, kwargs...)

                         input=nothing, frame_index=nothing, ax=nothing,
                         fig=nothing, outfile=nothing, yscale=nothing,
                         transform=identity, ylims=nothing, label=nothing,
                         axis_args=Dict{Symbol,Any}(), it=nothing, ir=nothing, iz=nothing,
                         ivperp=nothing, ivpa=nothing, ivzeta=nothing, ivr=nothing,
                         ivz=nothing, kwargs...)
